alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 1:33PM EDT until September 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Lake Park, Haverhill, Schall Circle, Port Of Palm Beach, Downtown West Palm Beach, Palm Beach International Airport, Lake Belvedere Estates, Mangonia Park, Lakeside Green, Cypress Lakes, Century Village, Westgate-Belvedere Homes, Stacey Street and Plantation Mobile Home Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
